forum.name: Prepare for Session 2.3
forum.intro:
In Session 2.3, you will continue to focus on routines that engage students in mathematical discourse. Specifically, you will be exploring 5 Practices for Orchestrating Productive Mathematics Discussions by Margaret S. Smith and Mary Kay Stein. You will work collaboratively to plan for implementing these practices.

To prepare for the next session, read the blog post from Illustrative Mathematics The 5 Practices Framework: Explicit Planning vs Explicit Teaching by Kristin Gray and be sure to watch the 2-minute video included in the post.

Discussion

Encouraging learners to talk about their thinking is a difficult task for teachers. Many times open-ended questions are met with silence or the same few learners share while others stay quiet. This is a challenge in whole group discussions as well as when learners are working in peer groups.

Share your experiences planning for instruction in the discussion forum below. Click ADD DISCUSSION TOPIC to add a post to the forum. Share any strategies that you use in your planning that focus on engaging learners to discuss their thinking in both whole-group and small-group settings.

Remember to read and respond to others’ postings so that this board acts as a collaborative virtual discussion. (Click “Discuss this topic” on an individual post, then click “Reply” to respond to that post.)
